website_summaries.verdict: The perfect pie pan for people who like to celebrate "Pi Day" on March 14 – or any day.
pros: This pie pan does more than symbolize pi, although it does that, too
It can cook up a little inside joke with your favorite pie
Well received by math geeks and bakers alike
cons: While the pan may be able to handle the dishwasher, you'll need to hand-wash it to best preserve its form

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pan for Pi Day!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to make a pie for a work Pi Day potluck, and it was a HIT!!!! The pan is sized to use standard deep 9 in crust recipe and filling, and bakes using the same oven temps and time. I’m looking forward to experimenting with banana breads, etc., with it. Coworkers were taking pictures and asking where I got it, so Amazon may be getting a bunch of orders! Best pan ever!!!! Thank you, Pi People LLC!!!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Not Great For Baking
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun novelty and is great to use as a serving dish, but not so great for baking. I've only used this pi pan for brownies; but no matter how much I grease the pan, I can never get the brownies to turn out in a whole pi shape, or even get the brownies to lift out cleanly in single pieces without tearing or sticking. A little disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Sew Friendly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Scientific Mathematical Baker
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a baker and a science/math nerd. She adored this gift. It is a novelty gift, sure, but what fun for her "All things Pi Party." The pan is a novelty decorative pan. Were she a professional baker, it might not hold up after multiple uses, but for a once a year baking or so, it was a great value for the price. I highly recommend this item if your baker is also a math or science person.
customer_reviews.author: Carla P.

customer_reviews.title: Was a Big Hit on Pi Day - Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Cooks well too. Good for brownies, especially if you like the sides to be a little crispier. Downside is that it is very soft metal. A butter knife will fairly easily scratch it. So be careful with it and don't let others go to town cutting pieces out. Hand wash. Also the edges are unrefined and a little sharp, but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: dano

customer_reviews.title: Novelty crap item
customer_reviews.text: Lower your expectations! It’s definitely not worth $25! It’s a shallow metal pan. I have no doubt it will take little to no time to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pan.
customer_reviews.text: This Pi pan was awesome. I made a pi pie as part of a going away gift for a fellow math professor, and he lit up. Everyone got a kick out of it, totally worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and a must have for math geeks!
customer_reviews.text: We also own the silicon pie/cake pi pan, but it doesn't cook evenly with 2 different layers. Plus you can't make a pie in it as easily as in this one, and this pan is larger. We also like the metal vs. silicon since it's more durable. Wish it came in non-stick, but... it's the only one out there. Best gift ever for my autistic boy who has pi memorized to nearly 100 digits and loves to bake. ;)
customer_reviews.author: F. Feickert

customer_reviews.title: Pi
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a pan in the shape of the pi symbol this is it. It is in fact a pi pan.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hasheider

customer_reviews.title: Great pie.pan
customer_reviews.text: Made a Pi cherry pie today. It uses a standard amount of pie filling for a 9" pie with a standard 2 crust recipe. It takes more work to fit the crust to the pi shape, but the result is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell

customer_reviews.title: but this thing was pretty
customer_reviews.text: the nooks and crannies make this hard to get the pie cut, but this thing was pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Score this one 3.14159
customer_reviews.text: This product is great , I would prefer it came in stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Pi Day birthday
customer_reviews.text: It's probably a better cake pan than a pie tin, but it was well received by my Pi Day birthday wife.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Aaltonen

customer_reviews.title: What fun! Brownies worked the best in the pan
customer_reviews.text: What fun! Brownies worked the best in the pan. It was a hit on 031415
customer_reviews.author: B. Matson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Super cute! Really fun to bake with. Nice non-stick surface too.
customer_reviews.author: jcurie

customer_reviews.title: Have your pi and eat it too!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected. Have not attempted pie, instead baked cake. Clever for pi day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This pan bakes cake and brownies better than expensive Wilton ones. I bought it specifically for Pi Day this year but it's such a nice pan that I think it'll be my go-to brownie pan!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: fun, easy to use, cooks evenly.
customer_reviews.text: works well. cooks evenly despite what you might first expect.
customer_reviews.author: CaryNC-AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pi day
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved it! The pies we made were such a hit! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Pie for Pi day
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to cut a slice out of it but still good to have for Pi day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pi Day!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect pan for a Pi Day celebration. It is well made and cleaned nicely. The capacity seems to be a little more than a regular pie pan, but not by much. My favorite pan!
customer_reviews.author: Diane W.

customer_reviews.title: Was so worried I was going to miss out on ...
customer_reviews.text: Was so worried I was going to miss out on the festivities this 3/14/15 @ 9:26:53.59, as I had only 20 minutes to get my blueberry pie cooked (as I was working with the top). A slight change on the baking directions and cooked it at 475 for 10 minutes, and 400 for the remaining 10 had a perfectly cooked crust. The tablespoon versus teaspoon of salt my helper put in the crust though was what left much of the pie uneaten.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This was a hit on pi day. I'm going to use this every year. It's way more fun than cutting a pie shape into a round pan.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: I just seasoned it like usual when I saw that it wasn't non-stick
customer_reviews.text: The metal of the pan is very thin and it isn't non-stick at all. But, since I haven't ever used a non-stick pie pan before, I just seasoned it like usual when I saw that it wasn't non-stick. Otherwise, it is a great pi-e pan. It is large, about the size of a 9 inch. It made a great amaretto dutch apple pie.
customer_reviews.author: amamac

customer_reviews.title: I love my new PI pan and can't wait to surprise ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping! I love my new PI pan and can't wait to surprise my son on PI Day!! A major holiday at our house!! Thank You!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We had great fun with this pan at our Pi party.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn weyer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this for daughter who is a math teacher ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for daughter who is a math teacher. She used it to make cake for her students to celebrate pi day.
customer_reviews.author: ADHDSH

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $25
customer_reviews.text: The first time I preferred it, it never showed up. Luckily I had enough time to replace it before Christmas but that stressed me out. The idea is great but I was so disappointed with the quality. It looks and feels like really cheap tin and for $25, I was hoping for something that was better quality
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very fun for Pi day. Great with brownies; didn't stick at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: PI day preparation
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect addition to my PI day celebration! So glad it arrived this far ahead of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This pan is a good sturdy pan and does hold a standard pie recipe filling. Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Allan Ingersoll

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It worked great and the kids loved the Pi Pie.
customer_reviews.author: Math Tutor

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect for our Pi Day Celebration
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect for our Pi Day Celebration! Had to use 2 homemade crusts in order to fill the pan but based on the other comments in the reviews I had already planned for that!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Denslow

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a pi-shaped tin. Not worth what I paid, but it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Is it Pi or Cake?
customer_reviews.text: Loved it and so did my Dad. I managed to get an entire cake mix in the pan but it was very full. I do think it cooks faster due to multiple sides so keep an eye on it. It is so much fun to be able to say "Is it Pi or is it cake?"
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Even though I greased and floured pan it still all stuck
customer_reviews.author: Patty A.

customer_reviews.title: okay but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: it worked. I made a pineapple upside down cake which I had to then turn right side up so it would look like PI since the pan only works if you sever the item in it. Also it needs flat rather then sloped sides.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie

customer_reviews.title: Nice size easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons birthday since he’s born on 3/14. Made a lasagna in it. Very cool
customer_reviews.author: Cuttingchef

customer_reviews.title: Brownie greatness
customer_reviews.text: Great pan! Works well for brownies and every piece has an edge! I have made 3 batches in it and it cooks/cleans well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was the perfect pan for Pi day
customer_reviews.text: It was the perfect pan for Pi day. Lucky me to find a jar of Door County Cherry Pie Filling at the nearby Outpost Co-op! A bit of challenge for getting the pie dough in just right the first time. Worth doing again and the pie disappeared quickly due to 8 eager pie eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan for Any Time You Want to Celebrate Pi Day!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is great when you want to celebrate Pi Day. I made a cake for the office Pi Day and it was a big hit. I just had to adjust my recipe to fit the pan. I'm glad I have it. It was easy to clean and dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Maughan

customer_reviews.title: but I love it. Feels durable
customer_reviews.text: Haven't yet used it yet, but I love it. Feels durable, and looks awesome! Can't wait to try it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pi Pie Pan makes Pi-cake perfectly. ....(say 3X fast now!)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in preparation of Pi-day. Great buy. An average stored-brand box of cake-mix fills the pan perfectly and I made a "Pi-cake" for Pi-day. Sweeeeet!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Conner

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make a pie on pi day. Have only used it once but it did just fine, I will probably only use it on special occasions. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Northern Gal

customer_reviews.title: Nice pan
customer_reviews.text: I really like the pan. It is bigger in volume than a regular pie pan, it requires 1 and 1/2 times as much filling. Best of all, every slice has extra a crust.
customer_reviews.author: Judebert

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and well made
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and well made. I gave it as a gift and the recipient made me a pumpkin pi pie. Very versatile!
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for bridal shower dessert for a Pi Day wedding!
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo Gal

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality material but the novelty of the shape is great.
customer_reviews.author: bill brockton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome addition for your PI Day fun
customer_reviews.text: Great lie pan used for PI Day with a jello angel food dessert.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Enright

customer_reviews.title: Well made and pie came out great.
customer_reviews.text: Who wouldn't want a Pi pie for Pi Day. Well made and pie came out great.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Rice

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pi Day
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making pi snacks to celebrate Pi Day :)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Neal

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This will be a perfect pie pan for Pi Days in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Robin LeVon

product_meta.title: Pi People Pi Pie Pan
product_meta.description: Pi Pie Pans, the Pi shaped pie pan, were made for those people who have a love of apple, cherry and the irrational as well. If you can recite Pi from memory to 20 or more decimal places, you need the Pi Pie Pan to celebrate March 14th in style. Be the envy of the office or classroom on Pi Day with this Pi shaped pan that has the same volume as a typical 9” pie pan.
feature_bullets: Pi Pie Pans, the Pi shaped pie pan, were made for those people who have a love of apple, cherry and the irrational as well.
If you can recite Pi from memory to 20 or more decimal places, you need the Pi Pie Pan to celebrate March 14th in style.
Be the envy of the office or classroom on Pi Day with this Pi shaped pan that has the same volume as a typical 9” pie pan.
